      java.awt.Rectangle getBounds(java.lang.String key)
      Returns a bounds that corresponds to the specified key or null if a bounds does not exist or it is outside of visible area.
      abstract java.awt.Rectangle getBoundsFor(java.lang.Object object, java.lang.String key)
      Returns a bounds that corresponds to the given screen and the specified key or null if a bounds does not exist or it is outside of visible area.

      • getInstance

        public static WindowStateService getInstance()
        Returns:
        an instance of the service for the application

      • getInstance

        public static WindowStateService getInstance(Project project)
        Parameters:
        project - the project to use by the service
        Returns:
        an instance of the service for the specified project

      • getState

        public final WindowState getState(java.lang.String key,
                                  java.awt.Window window)
        Returns a window state by the specified key. Also it adds a listener to save a modified state automatically.
        Parameters:
        key - an unique string key
        window - a window state which should be watched for
        Returns:
        a corresponding window state

      • getStateFor

        public abstract WindowState getStateFor(Project project,
                                        java.lang.String key,
                                        java.awt.Window window)
        Returns a window state by the given project and the specified key. Also it adds a listener to save a modified state automatically.
        Parameters:
        project - an project that specifies a main screen
        key - an unique string key
        window - a window state which should be watched for
        Returns:
        a corresponding window state

      • getLocation

        public final java.awt.Point getLocation(java.lang.String key)
        Returns a location that corresponds to the specified key or null if a location does not exist or it is outside of visible area.
        Parameters:
        key - an unique string key
        Returns:
        a corresponding location

      • getLocationFor

        public abstract java.awt.Point getLocationFor(java.lang.Object object,
                                              java.lang.String key)
        Returns a location that corresponds to the given screen and the specified key or null if a location does not exist or it is outside of visible area. A screen can be specified by Project, Window, or GraphicsDevice.
        Parameters:
        object - an object that specifies a screen to which a location belongs
        key - an unique string key
        Returns:
        a corresponding location

      • putLocation

        public final void putLocation(java.lang.String key,
                              java.awt.Point location)
        Stores the specified location that corresponds to the specified key. If it is null the stored location will be removed.
        Parameters:
        key - an unique string key

      • putLocationFor

        public abstract void putLocationFor(java.lang.Object object,
                                    java.lang.String key,
                                    java.awt.Point location)
        Stores the specified location that corresponds to the given screen and the specified key. If it is null the stored location will be removed. A screen can be specified by Project, Window, or GraphicsDevice. Do not use a screen which is calculated from the specified location.
        Parameters:
        object - an object that specifies a screen to which a location belongs
        key - an unique string key

      • getSize

        public final java.awt.Dimension getSize(java.lang.String key)

        Parameters:
        key - an unique string key
        Returns:
        a corresponding size

        public abstract java.awt.Dimension getSizeFor(java.lang.Object object,
                                              java.lang.String key)
        Returns a size that corresponds to the given screen and the specified key or null if a size does not exist. A screen can be specified by Project, Window, or GraphicsDevice.
        Parameters:
        object - an object that specifies a screen to which a size belongs
        key - an unique string key
        Returns:
        a corresponding size

      • putSize

                          java.awt.Dimension size)

      • putSizeFor

        public abstract void putSizeFor(java.lang.Object object,
                                java.lang.String key,
                                java.awt.Dimension size)
        Stores the specified size that corresponds to the given screen and the specified key. If it is null the stored size will be removed. A screen can be specified by Project, Window, or GraphicsDevice. Do not use a screen which is calculated from the specified size.
        Parameters:
        object - an object that specifies a screen to which a size belongs
        key - an unique string key

      • putBoundsFor

        public abstract void putBoundsFor(java.lang.Object object,
                                  java.lang.String key,
                                  java.awt.Rectangle bounds)
        Stores the specified bounds that corresponds to the given screen and the specified key. If it is null the stored bounds will be removed. A screen can be specified by Project, Window, or GraphicsDevice. Do not use a screen which is calculated from the specified bounds.
        Parameters:
        object - an object that specifies a screen to which a bounds belongs
        key - an unique string key
